business.headline: Sensex opens 130 points lower, Nifty below 25,500; HUL up 1%Sensex opens 130 points lower, Nifty below 25,500; HUL up 1%

Wolfspeed shares surge 248% in 5 days. What's powering this Nasdaq stock?Wolfspeed shares opened with a 43% jump on Tuesday over the previous day's close of $1.18 and reached an intraday high of $3.33. The stock ended the day at $2.52, up 9%.

Who is Sabih Khan? Apple's new COO overtaking Jeff WilliamsThe announcement came on Tuesday, with the company confirming that Sabih Khan will step into the role later this month. He takes over from Jeff Williams, who has held the post since 2015.

RCB overtakes CSK as IPL's most valuable team, league now worth $18.5 billionA report released by investment bank Houlihan Lokey said the IPL's business value rose by 13% in 2025 to $18.5 billion. At the same time, the brand value of the league increased by 14% to nearly $4 billion.

India, US hopeful of inking trade deal, but New Delhi firm on protecting key sectorsIndia and the United States are nearing a trade deal, with negotiations ongoing. India has taken a firm stance on protecting sensitive sectors, particularly wheat, maize, dairy, and genetically grown crops.

Will central government employees' dearness allowance reach 60%?The government revises the DA/DR rates twice a year, effective from January 1 and July 1. However, the official announcement generally comes a few months later.
Sensex closes 271 points higher, Nifty above 25,500; Kotak Bank up 3%The S&P BSE Sensex added 270 points to end at 83,712.51, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 61.20 points to close at 25,522.50.

Fincluencer explains why India's rich are planning to retire abroadIndia's rich are rethinking where they retire and how they invest. Finfluencer Akshat Shrivastava says it's not a whim but a calculated response to India's tax structure on wealth and income.

Earning Rs 80,000 a month and still broke? Finance coach explains what's wrongMany in their 20s and 30s are earning more than generations before, but their money often disappears into lifestyle upgrades, digital conveniences, and impulse-driven choices. The result is a sense of helplessness despite a good paycheck.

Bill Gates no longer in world's top 10 richest; trails former Microsoft CEOBill Gates now ranks behind Michael Dell, who is at number 11 with $137 billion, and Steve Ballmer, his former Microsoft colleague, who is far ahead at number 5 with $172 billion.

All you need to know about UAE's Golden Visa: Cost, application, documentationUnlike earlier Golden Visas that required big investments in property or business, this new scheme allows skilled professionals to apply based on their talent and work experience.

Jane Street vs Sebi: All you need to know about the caseAt the heart of the controversy is a long-running investigation into the firm's index arbitrage strategy, one that Jane Street insists is standard and legal, but which Sebi believes may have distorted prices in India's rapidly growing equity derivatives market.
Filed your ITR early? Will you get a faster tax refund?Filing an ITR early improves your chances of a quicker refund, but only if your return is correct, complete and verified on time.
Insured, but still deniedIn Part 2 of our series on India's insurance crisis, we explore why, for thousands of Indians, having a policy doesn't mean having protection when it matters most.

Jane Street to challenge Sebi trading ban, slams charges as inflammatory: ReportIn an internal email to staff over the weekend, the US-based firm said it was "beyond disappointed" by Sebi's accusations, which it described as "extremely inflammatory."

Have lost their tax edge: Expert sounds the alarm on ULIPsThe tax expert said ULIPs no longer guarantee tax-free returns. Investors paying over Rs 2.5 lakh annually may face capital gains tax—making mutual funds a more efficient alternative.
Sensex opens 65 points lower, Nifty below 25,500; Kotak Bank up 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was up by 72.04 points to 83,514.54, while the NSE Nifty50 added 16.50 points to 25,477.80 as of 9:40 am.

Market opening: How will Sensex, Nifty react to Trump's tariff announcement?While a US-India trade deal may help improve mood, the benefits may be limited to specific sectors. For today's session, Nifty to find support between 25,330 and 25,180 and face resistance near 25,510 and 25,630, say experts.

Trump's tariff list: 14 countries, new rates, and what they export to AmericaUS President Donald Trump confirmed that letters had been sent to several nations, warning them that if new trade agreements are not reached by August 1, increased import duties will be implemented.

Necktie Nomics: Can the RBI Governor's tie colour predict rate moves?An SBI report looked at the ties worn by the RBI Governor during Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) meetings. Instead of only watching inflation numbers or GDP data, they turned their attention to the shades of silk draped around the Governor's neck.
Sensex ends flat, Nifty below 25,500; HUL gains 3%The S&P BSE Sensex closed 9.61 points higher at 83,442.50, while the NSE Nifty remained flat to end below 25,500.
GCCs push India's office leasing to new heights: ReportGCCs are no longer coming to India just for cheaper costs. They now see India as a strong base for talent, innovation and large modern offices.

Sebi to intensify watch on derivatives trading after Jane Street episodeIndia is currently the world's largest equity derivatives market. According to the Futures Industry Association, it accounted for nearly 60% of the derivatives contracts traded globally in April.

EMIs hurt India's middle class more than inflation, says financial expertToday, almost everything is available on easy monthly instalments, from a new phone to flight tickets, even groceries. What was once a helpful option has now turned into a lifestyle. However, this is silently eating into people's income, leaving little room for savings or emergencies.

Filing ITR for the first time? 7 common errors new taxpayers must avoidFiling your ITR is not enough. You must verify it too. If you forget, the tax department treats it as if you never filed it at all. You can e-verify using Aadhaar OTP, net banking, or by sending a signed physical copy. Without verification, your return stays incomplete.

House rent above Rs 50,000? Here's the TDS rule you need to knowFor tenants living in high-rent homes, the line between a routine payment and a tax lapse can be thinner than it seems, and ignoring it can invite penalties that quickly snowball.

HUL shares gain 2% today. Should you buy the FMCG stock?HUL share price: The stock has gained 3.67% in the last five trading sessions. However, when looking at a longer time frame, the stock is still down 7.97% over the past year.

Lost Rs 18 lakh in 6 months: Financial advisor's warning on online bettingWhat begins as casual fun can spiral into secrecy, debt, and broken trust. A financial advisor warns that, without strong regulation, betting apps are fast becoming one of India's biggest financial threats.

Tariffs on steel, auto unlikely in interim trade deal with US: Government sourcesWith the US to soon notify countries of higher tariffs by July 9, with new rates effective August 1, sectoral levies on steel, auto and aluminium are unlikely in the India-US interim trade deal, government sources said.
Sensex opens 100 points lower, Nifty below 25,500; HUL up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 65.28 points to 83,367.61, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 16.45 points to 25,444.55 as of 9:50 am.

Trump reveals tariff letter plan with a twist: Here's what's coming nextTrump also said that any country supporting what he called the 'Anti-American policies' of the BRICS group will face an additional 10% tariff.

Stock market opening: Will Sensex, Nifty fall as Trump singals delay in tariffs?The Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,512 as of 8:08 am., suggesting that the Nifty 50 may open around its previous close of 25,461. Sensex and Nifty declined by 0.7% each last week.

The stark irony of world's 4th largest economy with 81 crore free-mealersIndia's growing wealth gap often sparks despair, but the author, a retired ESIC Regional Director, argues the real solution lies in enforcing India's long-ignored labour laws.

Oxford India Forum 2025 celebrates India's rising influence, youthful ambitionThe Oxford India Forum 2025 brought together a dynamic mix of business leaders, policymakers, entrepreneurs, academics and students to reflect on India's evolving global role and the path forward.

The Great Indian Salary CrisisWhite-collar employees in India are caught in a salary spiral where costs keep climbing, pay moves slowly, and financial stability slips further away. On paper, the economy is booming, but the pay cheques of working middle-class Indians tell a very different story.
India proposes retaliatory duties at world trade body against US tariffs on autosIndia has proposed to impose an equivalent amount of duty collected from products originating in the United States.

Real Estate vs Mutual Funds: Where should you invest, explains stock market expertOwning a house was once every family's dream, but times have changed. With high prices and new ways to invest, is real estate still smart, or are mutual funds better? A stock market expert explains.

Ankur Mehra says creators must think like startups, not influencersAnkur Mehra, in his new book Pixels to Profits, urges creators to stop chasing follower counts and instead build sustainable, multi-platform businesses.

Success isn't about number of followers in creator economy: Ankur MehraIn a conversation with Business Today's Sakshi Batra, Ankur Mehra, author of Pixels to Profits, explains what it really takes to succeed in the creator economy, and why chasing viral fame or follower counts may be the wrong metric altogether.
Sensex ends 192 points higher, Nifty below 25,500; Infosys gains 1%Sensex ends 192 points higher, Nifty below 25,500; Infosys gains 1%

entertainment.headline: Bad Girl: Controversial Tamil film on Brahmin portrayal censored, release date outDirector Varsha Bharath's Tamil film 'Bad Girl' will release in theatres in India on September 5. The film's teaser was criticised for its Brahmin portrayal and promoting alcoholism.

I'll be the man you are: Salman Khan to Atul Agnihotri in birthday wish postActor Salman Khan extended birthday wishes to filmmaker and his brother-in-law Atul Agnihotri with an adorable post on Instagram. He appreciated Atul's role as a husband and father in the sweet post.

Rajkummar Rao, Manushi Chillar seek blessings at Bangla Sahib before Maalik releaseRajkummar Rao and Manushi Chillar visited Bangla Sahib gurdwara ahead of the release of their upcoming film 'Maalik.' The film will release in theatres on July 11.

Samantha's Detroit photo dump features Raj Nidimoru. Make it official, say fansSamantha Ruth Prabhu shared a carousel of photos from her recent Detroit getaway. In one of the photos, she can be seen holding director Raj Nidimoru, her rumoured boyfriend, close as they strolled the streets.

Wellness & romance? Jennifer Aniston and Jim Curtis vacation together in SpainJennifer Aniston was spotted vacationing in Mallorca with hypnotist Jim Curtis, sparking dating rumors. Their shared interest in wellness and visible Instagram interactions hint at a deeper personal or romantic connection.

Sean 'Diddy' Combs to be sentenced October 3 after federal prostitution convictionSean "Diddy" Combs was convicted on two federal charges of transporting individuals for prostitution. He remains in custody as prosecutors seek a harsher sentence, citing his violent history and abuse evidence.

Pakistani actor, model Humaira Asghar found dead in Karachi apartmentPakistani actress Humaira Asghar was found dead in her Karachi apartment. Her decomposed body suggests she died weeks ago. Police await autopsy results and urge the public to avoid speculation.

BTS' V, Jungkook could attend Sojang defamation case hearing: ReportsBTS members V and Jungkook's defamation case against controversial YouTuber Sojang has taken a new turn, with the court now urging both sides to consider a possible settlement.

Johnny Depp breaks silence on being fired from Fantastic BeastsFive years after being fired from the 'Fantastic Beasts' franchise, actor Johnny Depp spoke about the moment he was asked to step away, and what it meant to him.

Jitendra Kumar on Sanvikaa refusing Panchayat 4 kiss scene: Taken out of contextActor Jitendra Kumar clarified that Sanvikaa's comment about refusing a kiss scene in 'Panchayat 4' was taken out of context and said her consent was always a priority. He added that any scene, including a kiss, should only be included if it adds value to the story and connects with the audience.

Ravi Mohan's estranged wife Aarti reflects on life in new post about love, peaceActor Ravi Mohan's estranged wife, Aarti Ravi, shared a self-reflective post amid their ongoing separation. Through a series of photos, she reflected on love, life, and finding peace.

Upasana Konidela urges women to find a partner who sees them as equalUpasana Konidela shared a note dedicated to women finding a suitable partner for themselves. She also emphasised marital conflict as a major issue and urged emotional education for boys to build healthier homes.

Kyunki is a side project: Smriti Irani says she is a full-time politicianSmriti Irani addressed the criticism of 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi', and shared that the show discussed difficult issues. She said in an interview that she is still a full-time politician, and a part-time actor.

Dipika Chikhlia on Arun Govil playing Dashrath in Ramayana: Really out of contextActor Dipika Chikhlia, who portrayed Goddess Sita in Ramanand Sagar's 'Ramayan' has reacted to Arun Govil's casting in 'Ramayana'. She expressed her views on Govil playing Dashrath in the Nitesh Tiwari directorial.

Hrithik Roshan wraps War 2: 149 days of blood, sweat, injuries… all worth it!Hrithik Roshan has finished shooting for 'War 2', which will release in cinemas on August 14, 2025. Directed by Ayan Mukerji, the action-packed film also stars Kiara Advani and was shot across five countries.

Jackie Shroff recalls why Dev Anand replaced him with Mithun as lead in Swami DadaJackie Shroff recalled that he was initially offered the second lead in 'Swami Dada' by Dev Anand but was later replaced by Mithun Chakraborty. Despite the demotion to a minor villain role, he accepted it out of respect for Dev Anand.

Actors Srikanth and Krishna granted conditional bail in drug caseThe Madras High Court has granted conditional bail to actors Srikanth and Krishna in a high-profile drug-related case, providing them temporary relief amid ongoing investigations. The actors must comply with strict conditions, including daily appearances before the investigating officer, to ensure cooperation with the probe.

Is Ranveer Singh playing this real-life spy in DhurandharActor Ranveer Singh's new look in Aditya Dhar's upcoming spy action-thriller 'Dhurandhar' has left audiences curious about his character. Is he playing National Security Advisor Ajit Doval? Social media users believe the actor might be portraying an unsung patriot in the film. IndiaToday.in shares insights on the two real-life characters.

Couldn't say no to flawed scripts: Vijay Deverakonda on nepotism, industry supportWith his upcoming film 'Kingdom' generating buzz, Vijay Deverakonda opened up about the challenges of navigating the industry without a support system and how that shaped his approach to scripts and creative control.

general news.headline: Trains halted, roads blocked: INDIA bloc protests over Bihar voter roll revisionRahul Gandhi will join the protest march at 10 am in Patna against the Election Commission of India's Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls, marching from the Income Tax office at Golambar to the Election Commission office. Tejashwi Yadav will also take part in the march.

Anybody that is in Brics...: Trump's 10% tariff threat to India, bloc membersOn Monday, the White House said that Trump viewed the Brics as a growing threat to American interests and pledged to take all necessary steps to ensure the US is treated fairly on the world stage.

Explosive for Pulwama attack bought via e-commerce platform: Global terror watchdogIn its latest global report on terror financing risks, FATF, the intergovernmental body that monitors money laundering and terror financing worldwide, said that digital tools and financial technologies are being exploited by terrorist entities to raise, move, and manage funds in increasingly sophisticated ways.

Indian-origin doctor suspended in UK for forcefully using forceps to deliver babyAn Indian-origin consultant gynaecologist was suspended after being found guilty of serious professional misconduct. She pressured a first-time mother at a UK hospital to accept forceps delivery despite the patient's clear request for a C-section. The woman claimed she was left traumatised, and the forceps caused damage to her baby's head.

How even non-citizens get to vote in India. The devil lies in Form 6The Election Commission is holding an intensive revision of voter rolls across India, beginning with Bihar, to update them and weed out non-citizens. But why did India allow non-citizens to get into the rolls in the first place? Form 6, which people fill to register as voters, doesn't demand proof of citizenship in the first place.

Wiaan Mulder aborted Mission 400. Could any Indian batter do the same?South Africa's Wiaan Mulder was unbeaten on 367 when he declared the innings-despite having both the time and momentum to chase down Brian Lara's Test record. How many Indian cricketers would've done the same?

Alcaraz dominates Norrie, Fritz knocks out Khachanov to advance to semisCarlos Alcaraz and Taylor Fritz sealed their berths in the semi-final of Wimbledon 2025 following their victories over Cameron Norrie and Karen Khachanov, respectively.

Bharat Bandh today: Strike by 25 crore workers likely to cripple public servicesA joint forum of 10 central trade unions, along with associated workers' and farmers' organisations, has called for the strike to register their disapproval of the "anti-worker, anti-farmer, and pro-corporate" policies of the central government.

Apoorva Mukhija, Raj Kundra to Ram Kapoor: Tentative Bigg Boss 19 contestantsAs Bigg Boss 19 is fast approaching, a list featuring the probable contestants has been doing the rounds. Apoorva Mukhija, Raj Kundra, Ram Kapoor, Tanushree Dutta and several others are likely to be part of the Salman Khan-hosted show.

Don't interact with media: Raj Thackeray's diktat to party leaders amid Marathi rowRecently, Raj Thackeray and the MNS received a lot of flak after videos of his party workers forcing a north Indian shopkeeper to speak Marathi and thrashing him for his inability to do so went viral.

No place for double standards on terrorism: PM Modi's strong message in BrazilIndia and Brazil reaffirmed their united stance against terrorism, with PM Modi emphasizing zero tolerance and no double standards, indirectly calling out Pakistan and China for supporting terrorist activities.

Diogo Jota speeding in fatal crash, initial forensic analysis reveals: ReportInitial forensic analysis reportedly suggests that Diogo Jota was likely speeding, which resulted in the fatal car crash that took place in the northwest region of Spain.

Samantha's Detroit photo dump features Raj Nidimoru. Make it official, say fansSamantha Ruth Prabhu shared a carousel of photos from her recent Detroit getaway. In one of the photos, she can be seen holding director Raj Nidimoru, her rumoured boyfriend, close as they strolled the streets.

Akash Deep: India's silent sniper who deserved Edgbaston's crownEngland vs India: At Edgbaston's Ramgarh, Akash Deep and Siraj played Jai and Veeru to perfection, slaying England's Bazballing bandits with sheer grit and fire. While batters basked in the sunshine, it was India's unsung guns who turned history on its head.

Barbie debuts first-ever doll with Type 1 diabetes to boost representationBarbie debuts its first doll with type 1 diabetes, promoting inclusivity, awareness, and representation. The doll features real T1D medical gear and partners with Breakthrough T1D to ensure authenticity.

Indian-origin Sabih Khan named Apple's new Chief Operating OfficerIndian-origin executive Sabih Khan becomes Apple's new COO, succeeding Jeff Williams, as India grows in importance for Apple's global strategy and manufacturing expansion.

Kolhapuri chappal row: Could Prada have done so with France's Champagne?Unlikely, say experts, as GI literacy is high in Europe, with centuries of tradition and various public and private partnerships to enforce it, while India lacks such mechanisms

Watch: Violent clash in Armenian parliament as government targets oppositionLawmakers voted to remove Artur Sargsyan's immunity. Without this protection, he could be prosecuted. He turned himself in to Armenia's Investigative Committee, which accused him and 15 others of planning to overthrow the government.

Kerala nurse Nimisha Priya on death row in Yemen to be executed on July 16Kerala-born nurse Nimisha Priya is set to be executed in Yemen on July 16 for murdering a Yemeni man. Negotiations for forgiveness and blood money are ongoing. She has been in prison since 2017.

Not happy with Putin: Trump blasts Russian leader over Ukraine, eyes sanctionsUS President Donald Trump criticised Putin over the Ukraine war's high death toll, dismissed diplomatic gestures as "meaningless," hinted at stronger sanctions, and confirmed US approval to send defensive weapons to Ukraine.

India Couture Week is back with fashion favourites (& what to expect this season)The line-up for the 2025 edition includes Rohit Bal, JJ Valaya, Malhotra, Ritu Kumar, Tahiliani, Amit Aggarwal, Falguni Shane Peacock, Mishra, Shantnu & Nikhil, Suneet Verma, Rimzim Dadu, Jayanti Reddy, Rose Room by Isha Jajodia and Aisha Rao.

We were 48 hours away: Iran says Israel strikes derailed Trump-led nuclear dealIran's Foreign Minister Abbas Araqchi revealed near-breakthrough nuclear talks with Trump's envoy before the Israel-Iran war. He urged US sincerity, as Trump confirmed upcoming negotiations and possible sanctions relief.

Sikhs, British and Afghans: The 19th century struggle for India's north-westThe 19th-century power struggle between the Sikhs, the British, and the Afghans shaped the political landscape of the time. Sikh ruler Ranjit Singh was in Kabul during a victory parade where the flag of Lahore was raised in 1838.

Asia's oldest elephant, Vatsala, dies in Madhya Pradesh aged over 100Vatsala was considered to be Asia's oldest elephant. Her last rites were performed by officers and employees of the Panna Tiger Reserve.

Bad Girl: Controversial Tamil film on Brahmin portrayal censored, release date outDirector Varsha Bharath's Tamil film 'Bad Girl' will release in theatres in India on September 5. The film's teaser was criticised for its Brahmin portrayal and promoting alcoholism.

I'll be the man you are: Salman Khan to Atul Agnihotri in birthday wish postActor Salman Khan extended birthday wishes to filmmaker and his brother-in-law Atul Agnihotri with an adorable post on Instagram. He appreciated Atul's role as a husband and father in the sweet post.

Rajkummar Rao, Manushi Chillar seek blessings at Bangla Sahib before Maalik releaseRajkummar Rao and Manushi Chillar visited Bangla Sahib gurdwara ahead of the release of their upcoming film 'Maalik.' The film will release in theatres on July 11.

Apoorva Mukhija, Raj Kundra to Ram Kapoor: Tentative Bigg Boss 19 contestantsAs Bigg Boss 19 is fast approaching, a list featuring the probable contestants has been doing the rounds. Apoorva Mukhija, Raj Kundra, Ram Kapoor, Tanushree Dutta and several others are likely to be part of the Salman Khan-hosted show.

While batters basked in the sunshine, it was India's unsung guns who turned history on its head.

Is it time to review Stokes' Bazball resume? England captain needs to feel heatBen Stokes in recent times has seen Bazball and England struggle, especially during the Edgbaston Test loss. With a poor run of form with the bat and questionable captaincy calls, Stokes needs to step up or face the heat.

Wiaan Mulder aborted Mission 400. Could any Indian batter do the same?South Africa's Wiaan Mulder was unbeaten on 367 when he declared the innings-despite having both the time and momentum to chase down Brian Lara's Test record. How many Indian cricketers would've done the same?

Diogo Jota speeding in fatal crash, initial forensic analysis reveals: ReportInitial forensic analysis reportedly suggests that Diogo Jota was likely speeding, which resulted in the fatal car crash that took place in the northwest region of Spain.

Joao Pedro heroics guide Chelsea past Fluminense into finalJoão Pedro delivered a dream performance against his former club, scoring twice to lead Chelsea to a 2-0 victory over Fluminense in the FIFA Club World Cup semi-final at MetLife Stadium on Tuesday.

Kusal Mendis' century deflates Bangladesh as Sri Lanka seal series with 99-run winSri Lanka completed a dominating 99-run win over Bangladesh in the third ODI and completed a 2-1 series win. Kusal Mendis was adjudged Player of the Match for his scintillating innings of 124 (114).

Alcaraz dominates Norrie, Fritz knocks out Khachanov to advance to semisCarlos Alcaraz and Taylor Fritz sealed their berths in the semi-final of Wimbledon 2025 following their victories over Cameron Norrie and Karen Khachanov, respectively.

PCB reward flop show? Internationals get more pay, domestic contracts reducedThe Pakistan cricket board have made a rather bizarre move where they decided to increase the pay of their international stars and not give better rewards for their domestic players. This comes after Pakistan's disastrous performances in ICC tournaments.

Jasprit Bumrah breathes fire in net session ahead of Lord's Test returnIndia fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah was seen breathing fire in the nets session ahead of his return in the third Test against England at Lord's.

Book my tickets: When Aryna Sabalenka nearly gave up against valiant Laura SiegemundAryna Sabalenka staged a thrilling comeback to defeat 37-year-old Laura Siegemund in a Wimbledon quarter-final. The intense match tested Sabalenka's resilience as she made her way into the semi-final of the grass-court Grand Slam.

Rishabh Pant picks Novak Djokovic to emulate his audacious cricketing shotsIndia wicketkeeper batter Rishabh Pant picked Tennis legend Novak Djokovic as the best man to emulate his audacious cricketing shots. Pant was recently spotted watching Wimbledon.

Alcaraz dominates Norrie, Fritz knocks out Khachanov to advance to semisCarlos Alcaraz and Taylor Fritz sealed their berths in the semi-final of Wimbledon 2025 following their victories over Cameron Norrie and Karen Khachanov, respectively.

Internationals get more pay, domestic contracts reducedThe Pakistan cricket board have made a rather bizarre move where they decided to increase the pay of their international stars and not give better rewards for their domestic players. This comes after Pakistan's disastrous performances in ICC tournaments.

The intense match tested Sabalenka's resilience as she made her way into the semi-final of the grass-court Grand Slam.

Rishabh Pant picks Novak Djokovic to emulate his audacious cricketing shotsIndia wicketkeeper batter Rishabh Pant picked Tennis legend Novak Djokovic as the best man to emulate his audacious cricketing shots. Pant was recently spotted watching Wimbledon.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
